core packageÔÉÅ

SubmodulesÔÉÅ

core.interpolation moduleÔÉÅ

Interpolation utilities for geophysical data processing.

core.interpolation.interpolate_to_profile(data: ndarray, X_grid: ndarray, Y_grid: ndarray, X_pro: ndarray, Y_pro: ndarray, method: str = 'linear') → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Interpolate 2D data onto a profile line

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì 2D array of values to interpolate

  • X_grid ‚Äì X coordinates of original grid (meshgrid)

  • Y_grid ‚Äì Y coordinates of original grid (meshgrid)

  • X_pro ‚Äì X coordinates of profile points

  • Y_pro ‚Äì Y coordinates of profile points

  • method ‚Äì Interpolation method (‚Äòlinear‚Äô or ‚Äònearest‚Äô)

Returns:

Interpolated values along profile

core.interpolation.setup_profile_coordinates(point1: List[int], point2: List[int], surface_data: ndarray, origin_x: float = 0.0, origin_y: float = 0.0, pixel_width: float = 1.0, pixel_height: float = -1.0, num_points: int = 200) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray][source]ÔÉÅ

Set up profile coordinates based on surface elevation data between two points

Parameters:

  • point1 ‚Äì Starting point indices [col, row]

  • point2 ‚Äì Ending point indices [col, row]

  • surface_data ‚Äì 2D array of surface elevation data

  • origin_x ‚Äì X coordinate of origin

  • origin_y ‚Äì Y coordinate of origin

  • pixel_width ‚Äì Width of each pixel

  • pixel_height ‚Äì Height of each pixel (negative for top-down)

  • num_points ‚Äì Number of points along profile

Returns:

X coordinates along profile Y_pro: Y coordinates along profile L_profile: Distances along profile XX: X coordinate grid YY: Y coordinate grid

Return type:

X_pro

core.interpolation.interpolate_structure_to_profile(structure_data: List[ndarray], X_grid: ndarray, Y_grid: ndarray, X_pro: ndarray, Y_pro: ndarray) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Interpolate multiple structure layers onto profile

Parameters:

  • structure_data ‚Äì List of 2D arrays for each layer

  • X_grid ‚Äì X coordinates of original grid

  • Y_grid ‚Äì Y coordinates of original grid

  • X_pro ‚Äì X coordinates of profile points

  • Y_pro ‚Äì Y coordinates of profile points

Returns:

Array of interpolated values with shape (n_layers, n_points)

core.interpolation.prepare_2D_profile_data(data: ndarray, XX: ndarray, YY: ndarray, X_pro: ndarray, Y_pro: ndarray) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Interpolate multiple 2D gridded data layers onto a profile line.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì 3D array of gridded data (n_layers, ny, nx)

  • XX ‚Äì Coordinate grids from meshgrid

  • YY ‚Äì Coordinate grids from meshgrid

  • X_pro ‚Äì Profile line coordinates

  • Y_pro ‚Äì Profile line coordinates

Returns:

Interpolated values along profile (n_layers, n_profile_points)

core.interpolation.interpolate_to_mesh(property_values: ndarray, profile_distance: ndarray, depth_values: ndarray, mesh_x: ndarray, mesh_y: ndarray, mesh_markers: ndarray, ID, layer_markers: list = [3, 0, 2]) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Interpolate property values from profile to mesh with layer-specific handling.

Parameters:

  • property_values ‚Äì Property values array (n_points)

  • profile_distance ‚Äì Distance along profile (n_points)

  • depth_values ‚Äì Depth values array (n_layers, n_points)

  • mesh_x ‚Äì X coordinates of mesh cells

  • mesh_y ‚Äì Y coordinates of mesh cells

  • mesh_markers ‚Äì Markers indicating different layers in mesh

  • layer_markers ‚Äì List of marker values for each layer

Returns:

Interpolated values for mesh cells

class core.interpolation.ProfileInterpolator(point1: List[int], point2: List[int], surface_data: ndarray, origin_x: float = 0.0, origin_y: float = 0.0, pixel_width: float = 1.0, pixel_height: float = -1.0, num_points: int = 200)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Class for handling interpolation of data to/from profiles.

Initialize profile interpolator with reference points and surface data.

Parameters:

  • point1 ‚Äì Starting point indices [col, row]

  • point2 ‚Äì Ending point indices [col, row]

  • surface_data ‚Äì 2D array of surface elevation data

  • origin_x ‚Äì Coordinates of origin

  • origin_y ‚Äì Coordinates of origin

  • pixel_width ‚Äì Pixel dimensions

  • pixel_height ‚Äì Pixel dimensions

  • num_points ‚Äì Number of points along profile

interpolate_to_mesh(property_values: ndarray, depth_values: ndarray, mesh_x: ndarray, mesh_y: ndarray, mesh_markers: ndarray, ID: ndarray, layer_markers: list = [3, 0, 2]) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

Interpolate property values from profile to mesh with layer-specific handling.

Parameters:

  • property_values ‚Äì Property values array (n_points or n_layers, n_points)

  • depth_values ‚Äì Depth values array (n_layers, n_points)

  • mesh_x ‚Äì Coordinates of mesh cells

  • mesh_y ‚Äì Coordinates of mesh cells

  • mesh_markers ‚Äì Markers indicating different layers in mesh

  • layer_markers ‚Äì List of marker values for each layer

Returns:

Interpolated values for mesh cells

core.interpolation.create_surface_lines(L_profile: ndarray, structure: ndarray, top_idx: int = 0, mid_idx: int = 4, bot_idx: int = 12) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray][source]ÔÉÅ

Create surface and boundary lines from structure data

Parameters:

  • L_profile ‚Äì Distance along profile

  • structure ‚Äì Interpolated structure data

  • top_idx ‚Äì Index for top surface

  • mid_idx ‚Äì Index for middle boundary

  • bot_idx ‚Äì Index for bottom boundary

Returns:

Surface coordinates line1: First boundary coordinates line2: Second boundary coordinates

Return type:

surface

core.mesh_utils moduleÔÉÅ

Mesh utilities for geophysical modeling and inversion.

core.mesh_utils.create_mesh_from_layers(surface: ndarray, line1: ndarray, line2: ndarray, bottom_depth: float = 30.0, quality: float = 28, area: float = 40) → ndarray][source]ÔÉÅ

Create mesh from layer boundaries and get cell centers and markers.

Parameters:

  • surface ‚Äì Surface coordinates [[x,z],‚Ä¶]

  • line1 ‚Äì First layer boundary coordinates

  • line2 ‚Äì Second layer boundary coordinates

  • bottom_depth ‚Äì Depth below surface minimum for mesh bottom

  • quality ‚Äì Mesh quality parameter

  • area ‚Äì Maximum cell area

Returns:

PyGIMLI mesh mesh_centers: Array of cell center coordinates markers: Array of cell markers

Return type:

mesh

core.mesh_utils.extract_velocity_interface(mesh, velocity_data, threshold=1200, interval=4.0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Extract the interface where velocity equals the threshold value.

Parameters:

  • mesh ‚Äì The PyGIMLi mesh

  • velocity_data ‚Äì The velocity values

  • threshold ‚Äì The velocity value defining the interface (default: 1200)

  • interval ‚Äì Spacing between x-coordinate points (default: 4.0)

Returns:

Arrays with x and z coordinates of the smooth interface

Return type:

x_dense, z_dense

core.mesh_utils.add_velocity_interface(ertData, smooth_x, smooth_z, paraBoundary=2, boundary=1)[source]ÔÉÅ

Add a velocity interface line to the geometry and create a mesh with different markers: - Outside survey area: marker = 1 - Inside survey area, above velocity line: marker = 2 - Inside survey area, below velocity line: marker = 3

Parameters:

  • ertData ‚Äì ERT data with sensor positions

  • smooth_x ‚Äì Arrays with x and z coordinates of the velocity interface

  • smooth_z ‚Äì Arrays with x and z coordinates of the velocity interface

  • paraBoundary ‚Äì Parameter boundary size (default: 2)

  • boundary ‚Äì Boundary marker (default: 1)

Returns:

Array with cell markers meshafter: The created mesh with updated markers

Return type:

markers

Initialize MeshCreator with quality and area parameters.

Parameters:

  • quality ‚Äì Mesh quality parameter (higher is better)

  • area ‚Äì Maximum cell area

create_from_layers(surface: ndarray, layers: List[ndarray], bottom_depth: float = 30.0, markers: List[int] = None) → <MagicMock name='mock.Mesh' id='1784892661200'>[source]ÔÉÅ

Create a mesh from surface and layer boundaries.

Parameters:

  • surface ‚Äì Surface coordinates [[x,z],‚Ä¶]

  • layers ‚Äì List of layer boundary coordinates

  • bottom_depth ‚Äì Depth below surface minimum for mesh bottom

  • markers ‚Äì List of markers for each layer (default: [2, 3, 2, ‚Ä¶])

Returns:

PyGIMLI mesh

Create a mesh suitable for ERT inversion from ERT data.

Parameters:

  • data ‚Äì PyGIMLI ERT data object

  • max_depth ‚Äì Maximum depth of the mesh

Interpolate 2D data onto a profile line

  • data ‚Äì 2D array of values to interpolate

  • X_grid ‚Äì X coordinates of original grid (meshgrid)

  • Y_grid ‚Äì Y coordinates of original grid (meshgrid)

  • X_pro ‚Äì X coordinates of profile points

  • Y_pro ‚Äì Y coordinates of profile points

  • method ‚Äì Interpolation method (‚Äòlinear‚Äô or ‚Äònearest‚Äô)

Returns:

Interpolated values along profile

core.setup_profile_coordinates(point1: List[int], point2: List[int], surface_data: ndarray, origin_x: float = 0.0, origin_y: float = 0.0, pixel_width: float = 1.0, pixel_height: float = -1.0, num_points: int = 200) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray, ndarray][source]ÔÉÅ

Set up profile coordinates based on surface elevation data between two points

Parameters:

  • point1 ‚Äì Starting point indices [col, row]

  • point2 ‚Äì Ending point indices [col, row]

  • surface_data ‚Äì 2D array of surface elevation data

  • origin_x ‚Äì X coordinate of origin

  • origin_y ‚Äì Y coordinate of origin

  • pixel_width ‚Äì Width of each pixel

  • pixel_height ‚Äì Height of each pixel (negative for top-down)

  • num_points ‚Äì Number of points along profile

Returns:

X coordinates along profile Y_pro: Y coordinates along profile L_profile: Distances along profile XX: X coordinate grid YY: Y coordinate grid

Return type:

X_pro

  • Y_pro ‚Äì Y coordinates of profile points
